terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control
Class WrmTranslationMapper

java.lang.Object
  terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.WrmTranslationMapper
public class WrmTranslationMapper
extends java.lang.Object

A convenience class "mapper" with an AbsoluteDragger input and a translation Actuator target. The target position will be relative to the position of the drag in the world on a WRM source object.

As with any form of WRM, an absolute dragger with no offset or scaling must be used as the event drag input. An AbsoluteDragger satisfies this condition, and provides support for mouse and keyboard input, and multiple source displays.

The event chain uses an IntuitiveDragMapper with a WRM plugin; connects that mapper to a source mapper with a direct plugin configured for translation; and connects that mapper to the target actuator.

Since this class deals with intuitive mapping, the target must be a single Actuator, instead of an actuation target exposed as an event out splitter.

Constructor Detail

WrmTranslationMapper

public WrmTranslationMapper(AbsoluteDragger dragger,
                            WrmDragPlugin wrmPlugin,
                            Actuator actuator)
Constructs a WrmTranslationMapper with a WRM plugin and a target actuator and reference space node.

Parameters:
dragger - Absolute display dragger. Never null.
actuator - Target actuator. Must be a translation actuator. The actuator's target node serves as the mapper's target space node. Never null.
Method Detail

getAbsoluteDragger

public AbsoluteDragger getAbsoluteDragger()
Gets the absolute dragger. Use it to configure dragger parameters (buttons and modifiers).

Returns:
Reference to the target actuator. Never null.

getActuator

public Actuator getActuator()
Gets the target actuator. Use it to configure actuation parameters (offset, scale, clamp).

Returns:
Reference to the target actuator. Never null.

getWrmPlugin

public WrmDragPlugin getWrmPlugin()
Gets the WRM mapper's plugin. Use it to configure the WRM mapping (source picking, etc.).

Returns:
Reference to the WRM plugin. Never null.
